movies.title: The Girl and the Playboy
movies.plot: A millionaire gets amnesia after a hit to the head and now he has to rediscover his past and decide what kind of man he wants to be in the future.
movies.simplePlot: A millionaire gets amnesia after a hit to the head and now he has to rediscover his past and decide what kind of man he wants to be in the future.

biography.bio: Dirch Hartvig Passer was born on May 18, 1926, on Østerbro, Copenhagen, to Ragnhild Fich and Capt. Vilhelm Passer (seaman). He never did well in school, being the class clown, which had a negative effect on his grades. He did especially badly in mathematics, which came to follow him the rest of his life. When Passer left school he wanted to become an actor, but his father insisted that he should become a seaman like himself. In 1944 he attended maritime school. Life at sea, however, did not go well - he was seasick all the time. After his failure as a seaman he had all kinds of small jobs. In 1946 he made his stage debut with "Six Comrades [seks kammerater]" in "Riddersalen". In the same year he was accepted in theatre school: De Frederiksbergske Teatres elevskole. After he had completed this education in 1948 he had many small parts in different plays all around Denmark's theatres. He made his film debut in 1947 as an extra in the Danish movie Lucky Journey (1947) and teamed up with Ove Sprogøe in the 1950s in many films. He became famous in 1953 with Ved Kongelunden... (1953), which let all of Denmarksee his his comedic genius. He made many other well-received Danish films, such as Baronessen fra benzintanken (1960), Mig og min lillebror (1967), Summer in Tyrol (1964), the Mafia-movies and Charles' Aunt (1959). Passer worked from 1967 to 1974 at the famous "Cirkusrevyen på Bakken", where he was responsible for their greatest success ever. Many of the sketches which he made here were so famous that they even seen all over the world. He made his last film in 1978, Fængslende feriedage (1978). In 1978 he acted in the "Tivolirevy", which he continued until his death on the stage of a heart attack on September 3, 1980. Like all great comedians he always wanted to play serious parts in movies and plays, but never got the chance. Dirch Passer was without a doubt the greatest Danish comedian ever.
biography.name: Dirch Passer

biography.bio: Birgitte Price was born on April 29, 1934 in Copenhagen, Denmark. She was an actress, known for Sin Alley (1957), Father of Four (1953) and Oh, to Be on the Bandwagon! (1972). She was married to John Price. She died on July 17, 1997 in Denmark.
biography.name: Birgitte Price

biography.bio: Malene Schwartz was born on August 10, 1936 in Frederiksberg, Denmark. She is an actress, known for 2900 Happiness (2007), Reconstruction (2003) and Flame and Citron (2008). She was previously married to Paul Hammerich and Christian Thomas Lillelund.
biography.name: Malene Schwartz

biography.bio: Sigrid Horne-Rasmussen was born on September 22, 1915 in Hellerup, Denmark. She was an actress, known for Altid ballade (1955), Ces sacrés gosses (1947) and Krudt og klunker (1958). She was married to Dirch Passer. She died on April 24, 1982 in Denmark.
biography.name: Sigrid Horne-Rasmussen

biography.bio: Bodil Steen was born on January 14, 1923 in Copenhagen, Denmark as Bodil Jørri Steen. She was an actress, known for Det hændte i København (1949), The Girl and the Playboy (1965) and I kongens klæ'r (1954). She died on January 10, 1979 in Denmark.
biography.name: Bodil Steen

biography.bio: Jessie Rindom was born on October 4, 1903 in Rostock, Germany. She was an actress, known for Vi er allesammen tossede (1959), En nat i august (1967) and Next Stop Paradise (1980). She was married to Gunnar Lauring and Helge Rungwald. She died on January 8, 1981 in Copenhagen, Denmark.
biography.name: Jessie Rindom

biography.bio: Johnna Lillebjerg was born on April 8, 1941 in Copenhagen, Denmark. She is an actress, known for The Girl and the Playboy (1965), Jensen længe leve (1965) and The Double Man (1976).
biography.name: Johnna Lillebjerg

biography.bio: Jeanne Darville was born on August 18, 1924 in Copenhagen, Denmark as Jeanne-Yvonne Maria d'Arville. She was an actress, known for Sømand i knibe (1960), Six Kids and Their Uncle (1966) and Relations (1969). She was married to Frits Helmuth, William Rosenberg and Jørgen Lunding. She died on May 9, 1995 in Denmark.
biography.name: Jeanne Darville

biography.bio: Bonnie Ewans is an actress, known for The Girl and the Playboy (1965).
biography.name: Bonnie Ewans

biography.bio: Paul Hagen was one the most famous Danish actors after the Second World War. He was born on 19th of March 1920 in Copenhagen. His father was painter named Åge Falck Rasmussen, his mother was an opera singer named Anna Hagen. Hagen was accepted into Frederiksberg's theatre school in 1944. He finished his education as an actor in 1945. He had his debut as an actor in 1944 in the play "Livet er jo dejligt" on "Riddersalen" in Copenhagen. He then worked at Aarhus theatre (until 1951). In 1953 he got famous for a song he made for "Fiffer Revyen". The song where entitled: "Lille Lise let-på-tråd". He worked in various theatres throughout the 50s, 60s, 70s, 80s and 90s. He finally said goodbye to theatre in 1998. Hagen had his debut in film in 1952, with the film: "Kærlighedsdoktoren". Hagen subsequently worked in 118 movies, plus TV series. In 1961 he worked with Preben Kaas, in "To skøre ho'der", were both of them wrote, produced, directed and acted in. In movies he frequently played a friend of the hero or a bright sidekick. Hagen had much success in the Danish film-series: "Støver-filmene", "Soldaterkammerater-filmene" and "Sengekants-filmene". Other notable appearances in film are: Bussen (1963), Hvis lille pige er du? (1963), Martha (1967), Ballade på Christianshavn (1971), Olsen-banden på sporet (1975) and Walter og Carlo - op på fars hat (1985). He married twice; first time with actress Asta Esper Hagen Andersen, with whom he had a son - Esper Hagen, who later also became an actor. He later married a woman named Alice Martens. On TV Hagen got very famous, throughout Denmark, with his role as the animal shop-clerk Clausen, in the very famous Danish TV series "Huset på Christianshavn" (1970). Hagen also acted in "Krummernes Jul" (1996). He died on the 20th of May 2003 and is buried in the cemetery: Langø Kirkegård, on Lolland.
biography.name: Paul Hagen

biography.bio: Ove Sprogøe was one of Denmark's finest and most treasured actors. Born in 1919 in Odense, where he also grew up, his parents were Arthur and Inger Sprogøe. He married his wife Eva in 1945, the same year as his stage debut at Folketeatret in Copenhagen. Through a long career in film, television and theatre, his most famous role was as Egon Olsen in the film series "Olsenbanden". The characters and the 14 films are common ground for all Danes and also became popular in Germany as well as in Norway and Sweden where local versions were produced. Even so, Sprogøe was always able to maintain a diverse range as an actor, playing all genres on stage as well as on screen. This included a multitude of popular comedies, a recurring role in the popular series Matador (1978) and a great number of variety shows. Ove Sprogøe died in the fall of 2004 and is remembered as one of the true greats of Danish film.
biography.name: Ove Sprogøe

biography.bio: Strøbye was most famous for his comedy roles, as the confused uncle in Min søsters børn (My sisters Children) and the hustler Gyldenkål in Familien Gyldenkål (The Goldcabbage Family). But his biggest role and success was in Matador the TV series a lawyer Skjold Hansen, he started his acting career and education as an actor at Det Kongelige Teater (The Royal Danish theater), he also worked at Folketeatret (The peoples theater). Strøbye made his movie debut in Nåler 1951 and his last role was in 1998, as the aging inspector in the legendary Olsen Banden movies.
biography.name: Axel Strøbye

biography.bio: Karl Stegger was one of the greatest Danish actors. Karl Stegger was born: Carl Johan Stegger Sørensen. He later replaced the "c" in his first name with a "k" to further his acting-career. He was born in Aarhus on the January 11th 1911. Stegger was educated at Aarhus theatre, where he was hired as an actor for 5 years until 1951. After 1951 he worked at various theatres all around Denmark. But Karl Stegger was mostly famous for his various, and mostly, bi-roles in Danish films and TV. Karl Stegger had his film debut in 1950 with smaller role in [Smedestræde 4]. Stegger subsequently acted in well over 160 films (almost everyone Danish), where he mostly played down-to-earth and sly types. Stegger seldom had a lead part in any film. He became famous in Denmark when he got the part of the father in the Danish film-series: "Far til Fire" in 1955, after Ib Schønberg died (who originally had the part). Another famous part he had was as the scrap dealer in "Olsen-banden i Jylland" from 1971. In 1971 he got a Danish film-price, a "Bodil", for a role as a real-estate salesman in "Ballade på Christianshavn". In his later years, Stegger became even more famous for his role as the Swedish-consul in the Danish TV-epic "Matador". His last role was in 1980 in "Trællenes børn". Karl Stegger died on the 13th of April 1980, he is buried in Søndermark cemetery, Frederiksberg.
biography.name: Karl Stegger

biography.bio: Preben Mahrt was born on July 28, 1920 in Hellebæk, Denmark. He was an actor, known for I, a Woman (1965), Kvindelist og kærlighed (1960) and Pigen og vandpytten (1958). He was married to Britta Annette Sylvester Hvid, Marguerite Viby and Erni Arneson. He died on December 19, 1989 in Provence, France.
biography.name: Preben Mahrt

biography.bio: Jesper Langberg was born on October 20, 1940 in Copenhagen, Denmark. He is an actor, known for Stolen Spring (1993), King's Game (2004) and Possessed (1999). He was previously married to Eva Jensen, Hanne Mørup and Susanne Heinrich.
biography.name: Jesper Langberg
